titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Byron M. Hawks papers, 1846-1899
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters concerning Hawks' student life at Dartmouth, 1846-1848; teaching in an academy at South Yarmouth, Massachusetts, 1848; problems of establishing a law practice on the frontier in Fond du Lac (Wisconsin or Minnesota) and personal and family matters. Most of the collection is made up of checks and bills relating to Rochester, New York.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Byron M. Hawks Papers, 1846-1899, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Byron M. Hawks was a lawyer and teacher, of Monroe County, New York.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters concerning Hawks' student life at Dartmouth, 1846-1848; teaching in an academy at South Yarmouth, Massachusetts, 1848; problems of establishing a law practice on the frontier in Fond du Lac (Wisconsin or Minnesota) and personal and family matters. Most of the collection is made up of checks and bills relating to Rochester, New York.
